dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, did you, uh, see the news this morning? I mean, global stocks just absolutely *plunged*. It's, like, wild out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, did you, uh, see the news this morning? I mean, global stocks just absolutely plunged. It's, like, wild out there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, A, yes! I was just looking at it. What, um, what even *happened*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, A, yes! I was just looking at it. What, um, what even happened?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's a huge mess, but the big kicker is crude oil. It had its biggest fall, like, since the 1991 Gulf War. Saudi Arabia basically launched a price war with Russia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's a huge mess, but the big kicker is crude oil. It had its biggest fall, like, since the nineteen ninety one Gulf War. Saudi Arabia basically launched a price war with Russia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] A price war? With Russia? Wow. So that's why everything's just, uh, gone through the floor?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A price war? With Russia? Wow. So that's why everything's just, uh, gone through the floor?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, pretty much. I mean, Japan's Nikkei index fell over 5% on Monday. Hong Kong, mainland China, all down. Panicked investors just flocked to safe-haven assets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, pretty much. I mean, Japan's Nikkei index fell over five percent on Monday. Hong Kong, mainland China, all down. Panicked investors just flocked to safe-haven assets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Japans Nikkei index fell more than 5% on Monday, while stocks in Hong Kong and mainland China were also down as panicked investors in Asia flocked to safe-haven assets like government bonds and the Japanese yen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like, government bonds and yen. People are just looking for *any* kind of safety.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like, government bonds and yen. People are just looking for any kind of safety.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...panicked investors in Asia flocked to safe-haven assets like government bonds and the Japanese yen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Europe followed suit. London's FTSE 100 was down almost 8% this morning. France’s CAC 40, Germany’s DAX, all down more than 6-7%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Europe followed suit. London's F T S E one hundred was down almost eight percent this morning. France's C A C forty, Germany's D A X, all down more than six to seven percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: European stocks followed suit, with Londons FTSE 100 index down almost 8% on Monday morning, Frances CAC 40 more than 7% and Germanys DAX 6%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That’s just… incredible. And the US futures were also sharply down, I saw S&P 500 futures, like, over 5%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just... incredible. And the U S futures were also sharply down, I saw S and P five hundred futures, like, over five percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. futures were sharply down, with S&P 500 futures down more than 5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah. And the oil prices themselves are just insane. Brent crude down to, like, $33 a barrel. West Texas Intermediate, uh, fell 31% to $28.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah. And the oil prices themselves are just insane. Brent crude down to, like, thirty three dollars a barrel. West Texas Intermediate, uh, fell thirty one percent to twenty eight dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices plummeted with the benchmark Brent crude down to $33.20 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate fell 31%, to $28.32 a barrel on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So this steep drop was triggered because Saudi Arabia just announced they'd raise production after the OPEC deal with Russia collapsed, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this steep drop was triggered because Saudi Arabia just announced they'd raise production after the O P E C deal with Russia collapsed, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The steep drop was triggered after Saudi Arabia announced it would raise production after OPEC's deal with Russia to supply collapsed on Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's it. And, uh, Australia also got hit incredibly hard. $90 billion was wiped off their markets. Their worst performance since the global financial crash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's it. And, uh, Australia also got hit incredibly hard. ninety billion dollars was wiped off their markets. Their worst performance since the global financial crash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some $90 billion ($140 billion AUD) was wiped off Australias markets on Monday, with the benchmark ASX falling more than 7%its worst performance since the global financial crash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ninety billion dollars? I mean, that's just, that's a huge number. And it’s not just the oil war, is it? It’s still, like, the whole COVID-19 situation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ninety billion dollars? I mean, that's just, that's a huge number. And it's not just the oil war, is it? It's still, like, the whole C O V I D nineteen situation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global markets have posted some of their steepest falls since the 2008-2011 financial crisis with panicked moves from investors spooked by the potential impact of the coronavirus on the global economy, and an oil price war.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. Goldman Sachs even warned that oil prices could drop to $20 a barrel if the coronavirus continues to spread *and* this oil price war intensifies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. Goldman Sachs even warned that oil prices could drop to twenty dollars a barrel if the coronavirus continues to spread and this oil price war intensifies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices could drop to a low of $20 a barrel, Goldman Sachs analysts warned on Sunday, if the coronavirus continues to spread and the oil price war intensifies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty dollars? Um, that's just wild. It’s definitely giving off those, like, 1970s vibes, as some people are saying.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty dollars? Um, that's just wild. It's definitely giving off those, like, nineteen seventy seconds vibes, as some people are saying.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's really, you know, some of the steepest falls we've seen since the 2008-2011 financial crisis.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's really, you know, some of the steepest falls we've seen since the two thousand eight to twenty eleven financial crisis.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global markets have posted some of their steepest falls since the 2008-2011 financial crisis with panicked moves from investors spooked by the potential impact of the coronavirus on the global economy, and an oil price war.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what are they even looking to now? Like, the G7? Are they going to try and, uh, coordinate something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what are they even looking to now? Like, the G seven? Are they going to try and, uh, coordinate something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That’s the hope, B. The Federal Reserve's emergency rate cut helped briefly, but now everyone's looking for coordinated action from the G7 to underpin the global economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the hope, B. The Federal Reserve's emergency rate cut helped briefly, but now everyone's looking for coordinated action from the G seven to underpin the global economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Reserves emergency rate on March 3, 2020, provided a momentary confidence boost for the markets, which now will look for coordinated action from the G7 club of advanced economies to underpin the global economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, I certainly hope so. This is, uh, definitely a lot to take in for one Monday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, I certainly hope so. This is, uh, definitely a lot to take in for one Monday.
